intro: Mentha longifolia f. virens, commonly known as green mint, is a cultivar of the mint family (Lamiaceae) characterized by its distinctive dark green foliage. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers in whorled clusters, which appear in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for both garden and container cultivation. This variety is prized for its aromatic leaves, which are often used in culinary and medicinal applications.
